name: Soca
description: Upbeat, poppy and danceable style rooted in Calypso and Indo-Caribbean Music; developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s in Trinidad and Tobago.

children.name: Bashment Soca
children.description: Highly energetic, Dancehall-influenced form of Soca developed in Barbados featuring dancefloor-oriented lyrics delivered in an aggressive chanting style.

children.name: Chutney Soca
children.description: Mixture of Soca rhythms with Chutney's Indo-Caribbean traits and instrumentation.

children.name: Dennery Segment
children.description: Developed in Saint Lucia in the early 2010s; heavily influenced by Angolan Kuduro, as well as incorporating elements of Zouk and Lucian drums alongside suggestive lyrics usually sung in Kwéyòl (Saint Lucian Creole).

children.name: Power Soca
children.description: Often at a tempo of 160 BPM and incorporating hard, frantic rhythms, highly synthesized production, and call-and-response vocals.

children.name: Rapso
children.description: Fusion of Soca and Hip Hop unique to Trinidad and Tobago.
